# countOfBytesClientExpectsToSend

**Instance Property**

A best-guess upper bound on the number of bytes the client expects to send.

## Declaration

```swift
var countOfBytesClientExpectsToSend: Int64 { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value set for this property should account for the size of HTTP headers and body data or body stream. If no value is specified, the system uses [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLSessionTransferSizeUnknown] instead. This property is used by the system to optimize the scheduling of URL session tasks. Developers are strongly encouraged to provide an approximate upper bound, or an exact byte count, if possible, rather than accept the default.

## Scheduling tasks

- **countOfBytesClientExpectsToReceive**: A best-guess upper bound on the number of bytes the client expects to receive.
- **NSURLSessionTransferSizeUnknown**: The total size of the transfer cannot be determined.
- **earliestBeginDate**: The earliest date at which the network load should begin.
